nodes.bodyText:
Add this as an @AssertTrue validation the config class (search code base for examples)
This should be checkArgument since it's validating an argument. IllegalStateException means the class is in an inappropriate state for the current method invocation.

It's better to tell users about the specific threat rather than a vague "improved security". How about

Passwords will be sent in the clear to the LDAP server. Please consider using SSL to connect.
Move this and the getter/setter to be directly after the URL, since they are related.
This can be simplified to ldapUrl.startsWith("ldap://")

Sorry for the confusion. The logging should be done in  LdapAuthenticator, as config classes should be pure configuration data. Also, from a conceptual standpoint, the LDAP authentication is where this matters. Simply creating/validating a config shouldn't cause a warning.
